intro: Vincetoxicum hirundinaria f. puberulum, commonly known as the soft-hairy agrimony, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in partial shade.
